intro: Spergula vernalis var. celtiberica, commonly known as the Spanish spring grass, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant typically blooms with small, greenish-white flowers during the spring season. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as rocky slopes and grasslands. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora in its native range.
